channel.title: Make Multi-Filters show all values by default
channel.description:
Multi-filters are really useful. But right now their behavior is not intuitive. I expect the filter to show me all the data by default. Only filtering out values when I intentionally select a values in the dropdown. Right now, Redash does this opposite: it shows **no data** until a filter value is selected.
I propose that a multi-filter should do nothing until the user chooses which values to filter. Or alternatively, allow the user to set and save a default value for a multi-filter in the query editor.

item.title: Make Multi-Filters show all values by default
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
No. We’re happy to review a pull request implementing it.

Read full topic

item.title: Make Multi-Filters show all values by default
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
jordanjennings:

Also - it seems the default behavior has changed since this post was created because the filters that I have tried select the first value from the list of possibilities and filter down to that value by default.

Yes it looks that way to me as well.

Read full topic
item.source: Make Multi-Filters show all values by default

item.title: Make Multi-Filters show all values by default
item.dc:creator: jordanjennings
item.description:
jesse:

Or alternatively, allow the user to set and save a default value for a multi-filter in the query editor.

I think it makes most sense to be able to save filter values with the query and/or the dashboard. I just discovered filters and was very excited to use them to speed up some dashboards that are backed by a slow query, until I found out you can’t set default values for them. Making the dashboard users select values every time they load the dashboard isn’t very usable.

Also - it seems the default behavior has changed since this post was created because the filters that I have tried select the first value from the list of possibilities and filter down to that value by default.

Read full topic
item.source: Make Multi-Filters show all values by default
